title: Question 1
prompt: Which statement best summarizes changes in Taiwan’s imports from 1991 to 2001?
description: Click the  <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The U.S., Japan, and Hong Kong are the only three single countries listed on the chart. Taiwan imported a smaller percentage of goods than each of these three countries between 1991 and 2001, as well as importing a smaller percentage of goods from Europe. The percentage of imports from ASEAN, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, and the “other” category went up. Both of these categories contain multiple nations. The distribution of Taiwan’s imports is more diverse.
